result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence John Pincolic Sr

defendant.name: Pincolic, Lawrence John, Sr
defendant.address: 8471 South Chicago Road, #22H, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. MOTION IN LIMINE

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic Sr in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Lawrence John Pincolic Sr.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 2/09/2022. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Court advises parties that this case was set before Branch 17 prior to judicial rotation. Substitution was later filed. Court further orders case adjourned for an additional plea/sentencing hearing to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting additional time to follow-up on Drug Treatment Court referral. Court sets 08/17/2022 as the deadline for filing change of plea forms and any sentencing documents. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Defense filed a substitution request. Case is reassigned to Judge Grayson. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense attorney not present for today's hearing. Case passed the case until the afternoon.

Case recalled. Same appearance with defense attorney present in court. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested an additional status date. Court set filing deadlines with parties. Parties are to file all motions by June 10th, 2022. Defense is to file any change of plea forms for June 22nd, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for John Rejewski for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Due to reasons stated on the record, defense requested to withdraw as counsel. Court GRANTED defense counsel's verbal request. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic in court in person with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith who appears by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 3/11/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Lawrence John Pincolic in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.   Edward O'Brien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 1p
